New Records: The Cavs' 136 PTS tonight is also the most the team has EVER scored in a season opener. The previous mark was 133 PTS at Charlotte to start the 1988-89 season.
The 136 points are the most the Cavs have ever scored in a non-overtime regular season road game.
Key Match Events: Evan Mobley’s game-high 25 points led six Cavs players who scored in double figures.
Donovan Mitchell added 21 points, three assists, three steals, and one block.
LeVert led the bench with 19 points and four assists as six of the Cavs players scored in double figures against the Raptors.
Pre-Game Insights: Kenny Atkinson revealed he texted Caris LeVert about his multifaceted role this upcoming season.
Atkinson coached LeVert when he was the head coach of the Brooklyn Nets between 2016 and 2020.
The goal behind the texts was to prepare LeVert for anything and everything, as the ebbs and flows of an NBA regular season would dictate the ever-changing roles.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cleveland’s new coach Kenny Atkinson wanted to start 2024-25 on a high note, and his Cavs followed through with the plan in their 136-106 season-opening blowout win against the Toronto Raptors.

The solid defending also opened up opportunities on offense as the pace and space approach led to Cleveland shooting at a 58.6% clip from the floor, 14-of-30 from deep (46.7%). They also scored 30+ points in all four quarters.
